data.value: Business combinations occur where an acquirer obtains control over one or more businesses, resulting in the consolidation of assets and liabilities.
A business combination is accounted for by applying the acquisition method, unless it is a combination involving entities or businesses under common control.
The fair value of identifiable assets acquired and liabilities assumed are recognised on the acquisition date.
Any asset or liability resulting from a contingent consideration arrangement is included in the measurement of consideration transferred.

Goodwill is calculated as the excess of the sum of consideration transferred, any non-controlling interest, and acquisition date fair value of previously held equity interest over the acquisition date fair value of identifiable assets.
Goodwill is carried at cost less any accumulated impairment losses and is tested for impairment annually.
Changes in ownership interests in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss of control are accounted for as equity transactions.
The Group consists of Aeeris Ltd and controlled entities.
Business combinations are accounted for by applying the acquisition method.

Goodwill is calculated as the excess of the sum of: (i) consideration transferred, (ii) any non-controlling interest, and (iii) acquisition date fair value of any previously held equity interest over the acquisition date fair value of identifiable assets acquired.
Accounts prepared on going concern basis.
The Company relies on a reliable annuity income stream from blue chip customers.
Financial assets are classified into fair value through profit or loss, loans and receivables, and held-to-maturity investments.
Initial recognition less principal repayments and impairment.
Recognized in profit or loss when they arise.
Over the shorter of lease term or useful life of improvements.
Immediate write-down to recoverable amount if carrying amount exceeds recoverable amount.

elements.title: Real and nominal effective exchange rates

data.value: In 2007 Kerry founded the Early Warning Network’s Geographical Notification and Information System (GNIS) and has been the key driver behind the development of the Group’s technology platform. Kerry is responsible for leading the Aeeris team in both the operation and further technical evolution of the EWN platform. Previously an Army Officer, Founder-Editor of NZ Green Magazine and Director of Earthtrust South Pacific, he has a depth of experience in establishing and growing successful businesses. In 1995 he launched a digital publishing and software business called Ezimerchant, which created one of the world’s first out-of-the-box e-commerce and DIY product and payments platforms.

data.value: Current income tax expense charged to profit or loss is the tax payable on taxable income for the current period.
The fair value of liabilities and the entity’s own equity instruments may be valued by reference to observable market information where such instruments are held as assets.
Deferred tax assets relating to temporary differences and unused tax losses are recognised only to the extent that it is probable that future taxable profit will be available.
Freehold land and buildings are carried at their fair value based on periodic valuations by external independent valuers.
A formal assessment of recoverable amount is made when impairment indicators are present.
The Group’s obligations for employees’ annual leave and long service leave entitlements are recognised as provisions.
At this stage there are no long-term leave entitlements.
The Group provides compensation benefits to employees in the form of share-based payment transactions.
The cost of equity-settled transactions is measured by reference to the fair value at the grant date.
The cumulative expense reflects the vesting period and estimated awards that will vest.
No adjustment is made for market performance conditions.
If an equity-settled award is cancelled, it is treated as vested.
The dilutive effect of outstanding options is reflected in earnings per share.
The Group provides compensation benefits to employees in the form of share-based payment transactions.
The cost of these equity-settled transactions with employees is measured by reference to the fair value at the date at which they are granted.
The fair value is determined by a Black Scholes model.
The cumulative expense recognised for equity-settled transactions at each reporting date reflects the extent to which the vesting period has expired.

elements.title: Responsibilities of the Directors for the Financial Report

data.value: The directors are responsible for the preparation of the financial report that gives a true and fair view in accordance with Australian Accounting Standards and the Corporations Act 2001.
The directors are responsible for such internal control as necessary for the preparation of the financial report free from material misstatement.
The directors are responsible for assessing the Group's ability to continue as a going concern.
The auditor's objectives are to obtain reasonable assurance that the financial report is free from material misstatement.
Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if they could reasonably influence economic decisions.
The auditor exercises professional judgement and maintains professional scepticism throughout the audit.
The risk of not detecting a material misstatement resulting from fraud is higher than for error.
The auditor evaluates the appropriateness of accounting policies used and the reasonableness of estimates.

data.value: This table shows the issued capital details of the company. The number of fully paid ordinary shares increased from 59,973,858 to 71,583,858 during the period, primarily due to two share issuances: 10,840,000 shares on 11 October 2021 and 770,000 shares on 6 December 2021. The monetary value of issued capital increased from $5,100,568 to $6,516,861. This represents a significant expansion in the company's share capital during the reporting period.

elements.title: Climate Risk Assessment and Data Quality

data.value: APRA has been interrogating the availability and quality of risk data at the largest financial institutions regarding climate risk.
Nearly a quarter of banks, insurers, and super funds had no proper metrics to measure and monitor climate risk.
APRA considers climate risk could have a compounding impact on credit, market liquidity, and operational risk.
Australia may follow other jurisdictions like New Zealand, leading to a mandatory disclosure regime on climate-related risks.
Aeeris is positioned to service climate risk data requirements with a balanced team and enhanced technology.

elements.title: Flood Risk Assessment and Climate Intelligence in Construction

data.value: Flooding across the eastern seaboard in the first half of 2022 has highlighted the need for businesses to assess their flood risk.
Climatics provides climate intelligence for 15+ hazards including flood risk.
As of July 2022, the commercial builder had achieved 46% productivity due to wet weather.
The Insurance Council of Australia estimates total claims from flooding exceed $21.3 billion since 1970.
A 19m flood could require evacuation of more than 90,000 people.

In 2006, Bryce established Veritas Securities Limited as a founding then, to his skill base by being an active company director for numerous private ventures in the funds management and IT/digital field.

data.key: Depreciation Rate for Plant and Equipment
Depreciation Rate for Plant and Equipment Leased to External Parties

data.value: The table shows depreciation rates for different classes of fixed assets. Plant and equipment has a wider depreciation range of 5-33%, while plant and equipment leased to external parties has a narrower range of 10-20%. This suggests that standard plant and equipment may have more varying useful life spans compared to leased equipment, which follows a more standardized depreciation schedule.
The Group has no significant concentration of credit risk with respect to any single counterparty or group of counterparties.

State Government Agencies, major rail customers, councils, and residents.

elements.title: Aeeris Team Active in Saving Lives

data.value: The Aeeris team engages in disaster response, focusing on saving lives during emergencies such as floods, fires, and storms.

elements.title: Climate Risk Assessment and ESG Initiatives

data.value: A climate risk self-assessment survey published by the Australian Prudential Regulation Authority found nearly a quarter of banks, insurers, and super funds had no proper metrics to measure climate risk.
The New Zealand government has made climate risk disclosures mandatory for insurers and banks, and similar rules could be imminent in Australia.
Aeeris provides unique data solutions that enable businesses to recognize location-based climate changes.
Empirical measurement, rather than subjective judgments, is essential for effective climate risk assessment.
Resolves the problem of producing forensic and trusted results using ‘actual’ data to deliver actionable and operationalized reports and risk disclosure.
Extreme heat weather can have devastating effects to your health. Heatwaves can cause droughts and wildfires and can lead to health issues and increased energy demand and water shortages.
up to three days in advance
Using its 12 years of non-stop operational experience and system development, EWN has evolved its primary platform to deliver a stand-alone SaaS cloud solution.
This product folds into our alerting and forecasting portfolio.
involvement in hail research projects with some of Australia’s leading universities.
